intro: Triumfetta brachyceras var. rothii, commonly known as the narrow-fruit triumfetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
